IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: On 11/07/2023 at approximately 1355 hours I, Trooper Norman was on patrol on Southbound I-270 North of I-370. At that time I responded to a call for a female pedestrian on Southbound I-270, North of West Montgomery Ave. When I arrived on scene, I observed Montgomery County Officer John Gallagher (#1534) on the right shoulder restraining a female. Gallagher had the female restrained against the barrier separating the main lanes from the local. Myself and Trooper Savilisky #7460, who did not use force, exited my patrol vehicle and assisted Gallagher. While exiting my vehicle my body worn camera would not properly attach to the magnet stripe and was mistakenly not turned on. The female was crying and screaming hysterically. Gallagher did not have his handcuffs on him at the time of the incident. I grabbed the females left wrist, brought it to the small of her back, and placed a handcuff on it. I then grabbed the females right wrist, brought it to the small of her back and placed a handcuff on it. The female was identified by her high school ID as: Kannika F, Bergoffen, A/F, DOB: 09/02/2008. Gallagher stated he observed the female crying on the shoulder of the local lanes on Southbound I-270 North of West Montgomery Ave. When he stopped to check on her, she ran across the local lanes and climbed onto the barrier separating the main and local lanes. Fearing she was going to get hit, Gallagher chased after her. He caught up to Bergoffen on the right shoulder of the main lanes where he restrained her until myself and Trooper Savilisky arrived. Bergoffen was transported by Montgomery County officers to Shady Grove Medical Center for an emergency petition. All events occurred in Montgomery County Maryland.

Case: 23-MSP-039197 Suspect: Kannika Bergoffen DOB: 09/02/2008 Witness: Xzavier Blackmane: Phone 240-380-9392 Johnathan Kransansky: Phone: 240-599-8383 Supplement Narrative Narrative: I, Trooper Savilisky, ID#7460, with the Maryland State Police Rockville Barrack, was patrolling inside marked patrol vehicle N-4, in the front passenger seat. Trooper Norman, ID#7454, and I responded to a call of a pedestrian on southbound I-270, in the area of West Montgomery Ave. Upon stopping on right shoulder of the main lanes, I observed Montgomery County Officer Gallagher #1534, restraining the suspect by using both of his arms to wrap around the suspects upper torso from behind. Officer Gallagher was using his body weight to press Kannika against the concrete barrier. I observed Trooper Norman use his right hand to gain control of Kannikas left wrist and place it behind her back. I also observed Officer Gallagher use his right hand to gain control of Kannikas right wrist and place it behind her back. Officer Gallagher was giving commands for Kannika to stop. Once Trooper Norman was able to detain the suspect, I maneuvered across the local lanes and made my way to the back entrance of the One Life Fitness Gym. Once at the rear fence, I spoke with a gym employee, Johnathan Krasnansky. Johnathan began to tell me how he observed the suspect make her way over the concrete barrier wall, and proceed to run across the local lanes of the southbound side of I-270. I also spoke with a member of the gym, Xzavier Blackmane. Xzavier also described the same scenario. Neither witness described ever seeing anyone chasing the suspect. This completes my involvement with this case. I request this case be closed with no further investigation. All events occurred in Montgomery County, Maryland.
